Package model

Class KoRStageModel

java.lang.Object
boardifier.model.GameStageModel
model.KoRStageModel
public class KoRStageModel extends GameStageModel
KoRStageModel defines the model for the single stage in "The KoR". Indeed, there are no levels in this game: a party starts and when it's done, the game is also done.

KoRStageModel must define all that is needed to manage a party: state variables and game elements. In the present case, there are only 2 state variables that represent the number of pawns to play by each player. It is used to detect the end of the party. For game elements, it depends on what is chosen as a final UI design. For that demo, there are 12 elements used to represent the state: the main board, 2 pots, 8 pawns, and a text for current player.

WARNING! KoRStageModel DOES NOT create itself the game elements because it would prevent the possibility to mock game element classes for unit testing purposes. This is why KoRStageModel just defines the game elements and the methods to set these elements. The instantiation of the elements is done by the KoRStageFactory, which uses the provided setters.

KoRStageModel must also contain methods to check/modify the game state when given events occur. This is the role of setupCallbacks() method that defines a callback function that must be called when a pawn is put in a container. This is done by calling onPutInContainer() method, with the callback function as a parameter. After that call, boardifier will be able to call the callback function automatically when a pawn is put in a container. NB1: Callback functions MUST BE defined with a lambda expression (i.e. an arrow function). NB2: There are other methods to define callbacks for other events (setupCallbacks() methods) In "The KoR", every time a pawn is put in the main board, we have to check if the party is ended and in this case, who is the winner. This is the role of computePartyResult(boolean) ()}, which is called by the callback function if there is no more pawn to play.

    • playerCanPlay

      public boolean playerCanPlay(PlayerData playerData)
      Determines if a player can make a move.
      Parameters:
      playerData - The player for whom the check is being made.
      Returns:
      True if the player can make a move, false otherwise.

    • gameIsStuck

      public boolean gameIsStuck()
      Checks if the game is stuck, meaning no player can make a move.
      Returns:
      True if the game is stuck, false otherwise.

    • computePartyResult

      public int computePartyResult(boolean renderGame)
      Computes the result of the game. Determines the winner based on zone points and total pawns placed on the board.

    • getTotalPlayerPointSimple

      public int getTotalPlayerPointSimple(PlayerData playerData)
      Gets the total points of the specified player by considering all cells on the board. Resets reachable cells after calculation.
      Parameters:
      playerData - The player for whom to calculate the total points.
      Returns:
      The total points of the player.

    • getPlayerZonePawnSimple

      public int getPlayerZonePawnSimple(PlayerData playerData, int row, int col)
      Gets the zone points of the specified player for the cell at the specified row and column. Resets reachable cells after calculation.
      Parameters:
      playerData - The player for whom to calculate the zone points.
      row - The row of the cell.
      col - The column of the cell.
      Returns:
      The zone points of the player for the specified cell.

    • getTotalPawnZone

      public int getTotalPawnZone(PlayerData playerData)
      Calculates the total number of zones owned by a player. This method iterates over the entire game board, checking each cell to determine the number of pawns in each zone owned by the specified player. It counts the total number of zones where the player has at least one pawn.
      Parameters:
      playerData - The player for whom the total number of zones is being calculated.
      Returns:
      The total number of zones owned by the specified player.

    • getZoneAverage

      public int getZoneAverage(PlayerData playerData)
      Calculates the average number of pawns a player has per zone. This method iterates over the entire game board, checking each cell to determine the number of pawns in each zone owned by the specified player. It then calculates the average number of pawns per zone.
      Parameters:
      playerData - The player for whom the average is being calculated.
      Returns:
      The average number of pawns per zone for the specified player. If the player has no zones, the method returns 0.

    • getNeighbors

      public List<KoRStageModel.PawnNode> getNeighbors(KoRStageModel.PawnNode pawnNode)
      Retrieves the neighboring pawn nodes of the specified pawn node.
      Parameters:
      pawnNode - The pawn node for which to retrieve neighboring nodes.
      Returns:

      Parameters:
      status - The status of pawns to count.
      Returns:
      The total number of pawns with the specified status on the board.

    • getPlayedPawn

      public Pawn getPlayedPawn(int row, int col)
      Retrieves the pawn played at the specified position on the board.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index.
      col - The column index.
      Returns:
      The pawn played at the specified position, or null if no pawn is played.

    • getPawnPot

      public PawnPot getPawnPot(PlayerData playerData)
      Retrieves the pawn pot for the specified player data.
      Parameters:
      playerData - The player data for which to retrieve the pawn pot.
      Returns:
      The pawn pot associated with the specified player data.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player is not red or blue.

    • getGeneralPot

      public PawnPot getGeneralPot(PlayerData playerData)
      Retrieves the pawn pot that still has pawns for the specified player data. If the initial pawn pot is empty, it checks the next player's pawn pot.
      Parameters:
      playerData - The player data for which to retrieve the pawn pot.
      Returns:
      The pawn pot that still has pawns, or null if both are empty.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player is not red or blue.
